text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

Whoever, while acting for profit or other financial gain, knowingly directs or participates in an
			 effort or scheme to assist or cause five or more persons (other than a
			 parent, spouse, or child of the offender)—
to enter, attempt to enter, or prepare to enter the United States—
by fraud, falsehood, or other corrupt means;
at any place other than a port or place of entry designated by the
in a manner not prescribed by the immigration laws and regulations of the United States; or
to travel by air, land, or sea toward the United States (whether directly or indirectly)—

knowing that the persons seek to enter or attempt to enter the United States without lawful
			 authority; and
with the intent to aid or further such entry or attempted entry; or

text.#text: In this section, the term

means permission, authorization, or license that is expressly provided for in the immigration laws
			 of the United States or accompanying regulations; and

does not include any such authority secured by fraud or otherwise obtained in violation of law, nor
			 does it include authority sought, but not approved.

quote.#tail:
does not require that the five or more persons enter, attempt to enter, prepare to enter, or
			 travel at the same time so long as the acts are completed within one year.

text.#text: For purposes of this section,

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall implement a strategy to deter, detect, and interdict human
			 smuggling across the international land and maritime borders of the United
			 States.

text.#text: Not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall include, at a minimum, the following components:

text.#text: The strategy referred to in
Efforts to increase coordination between the border and maritime security components of the

			 States.

Whoever knowingly transmits to another person the location, movement, or activities of any Federal,

text.#text:
Whoever knowingly and without lawful authorization destroys, alters, or damages any fence, barrier,
			 sensor, camera, or other physical or electronic device deployed by the
